7 votes in total on Snapshot for the @ENS_DAO! 

- 4 x WG funding proposals
- [EP6.1] Removal of Brantly Millegan as Director of The ENS Foundation
- [EP6.2] Election of a new Director of The ENS Foundation
- [EP 8] Reimburse TNL for expenses and tax

https://t.co/9B3m6mj3fZ

[EP7.4] Public Goods WG

- $50k USDC for Public Goods subgroups (incl. research on PG definition, and grants program setup)
- $38k USDC operational WG budget and coordination comp
- $12k USDC for steward comp

[EP7.3] Community WG

- $49k USDC, 1 ETH, and 650 $ENS for community subgroups (incl. learn docs, comms, translation, onboarding, Spanish community.)
- $66k USDC for Support Mod comp
- $27,500 USDC for steward comp and coordination comp

[EP7.2] Ecosystem WG

- $50k USDC for ecosystem subgroups (incl. hackathons, third party projects, dot eth websites, and bug bounty)
- $50k USDC one-off to fund the bug bounty
- $27,500 USDC for steward comp and coordination comp

[EP7.1] Meta-Governance WG

- $50k USDC for meta-governance subgroups (incl. treasury management, DAO governance, and DAO tooling)
- 2,700 $ENS for steward comp and coordination comp

the 4 working groups of the @ENS_DAO have funding requests proposals for Q1/Q2 2022 live now!

ENS Delegates can vote on Snapshot over the next 5 days

https://t.co/7WBdMwYFTT

3/ the community has an opportunity to demonstrate that ENS is more than the opinions of one personâ€”that the values of web3 are reflected in those that hold power and influence in the space

2/ what makes web3 special is the inclusion* of so many people who have previously been excluded or unable to participate in building the tools that shape our society + values

*inclusion is more than not excluding, it's a baseline level of respect for everyone's lived experience

ENS is for everyone
